{"step_by_step_thinking": "TTN is a condition that causes breathing problems in newborn babies due to the fluid in their lungs not going away as quickly as it should after birth. From the documents, it is clear that TTN is more common in babies born via cesarean section, especially elective cesarean section, as mentioned in documents 1, 9, 10, 12, 14, 20, and 24. There is no mention of TTN being more common in term deliveries requiring forceps, term requiring ventouse, or normal vaginal deliveries.", "answer_choice": "C. Elective caesarean section"}
